page.title: 05ROBERT HALL FARM - THE LAND
page.content: The farm is at present tenanted by Guy Hope and covers 110 hectres. Because of the climate which is rather wet and dull and the rough, steep terrain the land is not suitable for arable farming, so Mr Hope is a dairy farmer. In 1984 10 acres of land were drained to improve the grass as regulations encourage greater use of grass to replace expensive cattle feed. Robert Hall has a moor of 50 acres which has been declared an area of scientific interest by the NCC because of the large number of rare wild flowers there. Mr Hope is unable to touch the land without permission but because he is unable to use it he is compensated by the NCC.
